solution_line_template: From the {boxes} boxes, Nori had {crayons_per_box} * {boxes} = <<{crayons_per_box}*{boxes}={total_crayons}>>{total_crayons} crayons
After giving {mae_crayons} crayons to Mae, she had {total_crayons} - {mae_crayons} = <<{total_crayons}-{mae_crayons}={after_mae}>>{after_mae} crayons left.
If she only has {crayons_left} crayons now, this means she gave Lea {after_mae} - {crayons_left} = <<{after_mae}-{crayons_left}={lea_crayons}>>{lea_crayons} crayons.
Hence, Lea has {lea_crayons} - {mae_crayons} = <<{lea_crayons}-{mae_crayons}={difference}>>{difference} more crayons than Mae.
